segments.content:
* Editing UI for your Markdown files
* UI for MDX components
* Supports static (SSG) and server-side rendering (SSR)
* Option for visual editing (live-preview)
* Build with reusable blocks

segments.content: Comprehensive, well-illustrated article on React 18 and its impact on performance. Explains how Concurrent React works and its impact on metrics such as Total Blocking Time and Interaction to Next Paint. Also presents other new features such as the Transition API, React Server Components, Suspense and the new React cache.
segments.sourceMdx: Comprehensive, well-illustrated article on React 18 and its impact on performance. Explains how Concurrent React works and its impact on metrics such as Total Blocking Time and Interaction to Next Paint. Also presents other new features such as the Transition API, React Server Components, Suspense and the new React cache.

segments.content: New CSS-in-JS library inspired by the DX offered by Chakra UI, and compatible with React Server Components. The library is based on a unique hybride method that combines the best of zero-runtime CSS-in-JS and traditional runtime solutions. We'll have to study all this, and see how this library stands up to [Panda CSS](https://panda-css.com/) from the Chakra team.
segments.sourceMdx: New CSS-in-JS library inspired by the DX offered by Chakra UI, and compatible with React Server Components. The library is based on a unique hybride method that combines the best of zero-runtime CSS-in-JS and traditional runtime solutions. We'll have to study all this, and see how this library stands up to [Panda CSS](https://panda-css.com/) from the Chakra team.

* ğŸ¦ [DevRel Matt Carroll rejoined the React team](https://twitter.com/mattcarrollcode/status/1681342638816112641)

* ğŸ“œ [My take on the current React & Server Components controversy](https://phryneas.de/react-server-components-controversy): Lenz loves the React Server Components but explains his frustration as a maintainer of Apollo Client and Redux Toolkit.
* ğŸ“œ [Demystifying React Server Components with NextJS 13 App Router](https://demystifying-rsc.vercel.app/): a great demo application with well-illustrated notes explaining how Server Components work, including many code and network payload samples.
* ğŸ“œ [5 Common Pitfalls with Server Components in Next13 (with examples)](https://www.propelauth.com/post/5-common-pitfalls-with-server-components-in-next13-with-examples): well-illustrated article presenting the most common errors when using Server Components.
* ğŸ“œ [Trimming typography with Capsize](https://www.skovy.dev/blog/using-capsize-with-stitches): explains how to trim and normalise whitespaces around your fonts to facilitate alignment, in a React context.
* ğŸ“œ [SvelteJS: My ecosystem is bigger than yours](https://hackmd.io/@roguegpu/r1RKQMdt3): interesting criticism of React in favour of Svelte, which doesn't need as much of an ecosystem.
* ğŸ“œ [Why Server Components - A Brief History of Web](https://www.perssondennis.com/articles/why-server-components-a-brief-history-of-web)

segments.content: The new SDK 49 has just been released. Many new features have been announced, including my favourites:
segments.sourceMdx: The new SDK 49 has just been released. Many new features have been announced, including my favourites:

segments.content:
* React Native 0.72.3, React Native Web 0.19.6
* Expo Router v2.0
* Network debugging, VS Code debugging
* React devtools built-in
* Environment variables
* Local Expo Modules
* EAS Insights
segments.sourceMdx:
- React Native 0.72.3, React Native Web 0.19.6
- Expo Router v2.0
- Network debugging, VS Code debugging
- React devtools built-in
- Environment variables
- Local Expo Modules
- EAS Insights

segments.content: Along with SDK 49, Expo is also announcing the release of Expo Router v2 with many enhancements, including:
segments.sourceMdx: Along with SDK 49, Expo is also announcing the release of Expo Router v2 with many enhancements, including:

segments.content:
* TypeScript support
* Static routes, SEO, Head metadata
* Async routes
* Universal Linking, handoff
* CSS and Styling
segments.sourceMdx:
- TypeScript support
- Static routes, SEO, Head metadata
- Async routes
- Universal Linking, handoff
- CSS and Styling

segments.content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!
segments.sourceMdx: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

segments.content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is \~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe\_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.
